newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish reserve money PLN 33 bln, within target band.
newsitem.headline: Polish reserve money PLN 33 bln, within target band.

text.p: The average level of reserve money in October was 33.00 billion zlotys, within the target band of 32.95 to 33.65 billion zlotys, the National Bank of Poland's Open Market Committee said in a statement.
Reserve money, also called high powered money or monetary base, consists of cash in circulation, cash in vaults and obligatory reserves.
Since January 1996, it has served as the operating target of the central bank's monetary policy, through which it wants to control money supply growth and inflation.
